Fields.DialogueText: Yūbari, we've got to keep this ship clean! What are you doing?
I'm just having my usual cup of coffee, Kanchou.
There are dirty coffee mugs everywhere. And you need to use a coaster! Look, now the table is stained.
Don't get your bolero in a bunch.
Yūbari, you know that we're having a special visit from Command, right?
We are?

Fields.MenuText: In a matter of days.
No, I just do this to keep you on your toes.
What do you mean, "we are?"

Fields.DialogueText: Oh, shoot. I guess I must have forgotten. That's my fault, Kanchou.
Was that sarcasm? I think that was sarcasm. I guess the commanding officer is coming.
Hmm, now that you mention it, I did mark my calendar as doing something special...
What a mess. I don't think they're going to like your outfit, either.
They know I'm the best in the whole Imperial Navy. Maybe the whole Fleet. If they don't like it, I'll give 'em a little frontier justice! Hyah!
Please don't fight our commanders, Yūbari.
Come on, take a joke. We're going to be fine.
Just stay down here and clean, Yūbari. I'm going to go meet with them right now.
Looks like a few coffee cups are the least of their worries.
*ALARM*
Can't argue with that... much as I'd like to.
@BATTLE
Kanchou! Your meeting ended? That was quicker than expected. I noticed you didn't give the admiral a tour.
It seems we have a new assignment. I was given this envelope.
What do you think it is?

Fields.MenuText: Perhaps a new mission?
Could be a letter of resignation.
A bonus, I hope.

Fields.DialogueText: Great, another chance to go on a grand adventure!
Does that mean you get to be the new admiral? What an honor!
With that money, I can finally buy those antique pistols I've been wanting!
Here, you open it. I can't.
What's gotten into you lately? Give it to me, I'll open it.
I'm going to assume that you have clearance, under the circumstances. Go ahead, read it.
*BOOM*
Whoa! Looks like we'll have to wait. We're under attack!
Not only that, but the admiral's nearby. Their ship's going to need backup!
@BATTLE
Hmm... It is a mission. Top secret. Like, super top secret.
Captain, it's a Morgana ambush!
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
Wow, those Funayūrei almost got us good! I haven't been hit by a surprise attack like that in a long time.
I wonder if they were actually trying to intercept that letter we received from the admiral.
If they knew about it, they would have gone for a capture rather than a kill. I've heard they like to do that. What do you think it says?
You're the one who stole it.
Oh, right.
AHEM! "Due to the exemplary performance of Yūbari and her crew..." That's us, Kanchou!
Keep going.
"... It is the opinion of Command that Yūbari is uniquely suited for a delivery... package at a location henceforth designated Outpost A... client at Outpost B..."
See for yourself, Kanchou. There are photos attached of what we need to deliver. Can't make head or tail or it.
Do our orders say what it's for?
They didn't say. It must be something important to the war effort.

Fields.MenuText: I have a troublesome feeling about this, Yūbari.
We should make sure the crew is informed.
I can't wait to get out to the open seas.

Fields.DialogueText: Me too, Kanchou. I hate not knowing what we're signing up for.
I wish we knew more. The crew need to know the magnitude of what we're getting into.
Ahh, it's my favorite feeling! So much ocean to explore and beat Funayūrei in!
Quick on the draw, Yūbari?
Hai! The quickest.
You're skimming.
Well, we have our orders.
Whatever they are.
So, Kanchou, we've decided to accept the mission.
That's right. We're heading out right now.
Sure would help if we knew what we were doing all this for.

Fields.MenuText: To fight some Funayūrei.
To keep the human race on its feet.
I don't really know.

Fields.DialogueText: Mochiron. But they're a sandstorm, Kanchou. The world around you doesn't go away just because you can't see through the dust.
It's a noble goal, that's sure. But it's open to interpretation.
I guess only time will tell. Well, my guns are loaded and we're all saddled up.
I've already charted our course to the first outpost.
Hmm. That takes us through some heavy Funayūrei territory.
There are alternate routes, but...
Have you ever seen me back down from a fight? Let's take them on!
Well, let's not get ahead of ourselves. This is going to be a long, long journey.
Be longer if we take the easy way. And it starts with a single step.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
A very explosive step.
Well, now, isn't that a surprise?
What?
The Funayūrei have been tailing us for some time now.

Fields.MenuText: What are they planning?
I hope they don't catch up to us.
I'm not surprised. Not one bit.

Fields.DialogueText: Does it matter? They show up and we blast them back to the bottom.
Well, if they do, I've got a fistful of shells for 'em.
We sure are popular, aren't we?
I read that big prairie cats can smell fear. Do you think that's true of the Funayūrei?
We did, Kanchou, and I did some serious thinking. But whether it's true or not, I think the message is the same.
Thanks, Yūbari. I think I was getting a little on edge there.
Mondainai. It's what I do best. If there's one thing comics have taught me, it's never to back down just because something's scary.
What if you're overwhelmed?
You ever read about Butch Cassidy and the Sundance Kid?
@BATTLE
I thought we'd talked about what's real and what's not.
No matter what we face, we breathe deep, look it in the eye, and light it up. There's no time for hesitation.
That's what I think it means, anyway.
*ALARM*
Didn't they fight an army or something?
They might have been no-good outlaws, but they fought to the end. And they sure didn't have guns like mine!
Kanchou! Funayūrei sighted on the edge of the ship. Looks like a shootout. Great? All right!
I don't think the coffee has worn off.
Dead wrong, Kanchou. I needed another.
Another coffee? Yūbari...
It's all for a good reason. We've got to stay one step ahead of the Funayūrei!
Actually, we're trying to avoid conflict while we reach the outpost.
Oh, right. Well, that won't be so bad. It's just one battle.

Fields.MenuText: I guess you're right.
It's a waste of our time.
This battle may be our last!

Fields.DialogueText: Yeah, so what gives? I mean, we're just going to win, right? We'll be fine!
I know we're pressed for time, but we'll make this battle quick.
You have to fight every battle like it's your last. Don't ever get in your own way.
It can't be helped, though. Right, prepare for battle! Launch the assault on the Funayūrei!
Aye-aye, Kanchou! Let's give 'em a little Sasebo shipyard spice!
@BATTLE
So, where do we go from here? We should have reached the outpost by now.
Let me check. Got the charts?
Right here. We're still on course, aren't we?
Hmm... judging by the shape of the waves, and the prevailing winds...
Well?
Looks like some of our evasives got us turned around. We're not that far off course, but it put us out of our way enough for another group of Funayūrei to notice.
So we're still deep in Morgana territory.
When you're in the middle of a desert, keep walking.

Fields.MenuText: Are you sure there's no other way?
Can we try a different strategy?
Then I say bring them on!

Fields.DialogueText: Not a chance. If we pull back now, they're just going to swarm us, and then we'll really be goners.
We could stand and fight, but a running battle gets us home quicker. I can't think of any better strategy than this.
All right, Kanchou. I like it when you're daring!
All this for a mission we don't even understand. The answer's above my pay grade, I guess.
I guess. What's weird is that it's also above mine.
@BATTLE
Some of the higher-ups might never get used to telling the ships what's going on.
Nah. If anyone was ready to talk to us, it was Japan. My people are just used to the Kami staying in a different world than this one.
It must be something big, then.
All the more reason to fight these Funayūrei the same as we always do. We don't want to tip our hand when we're all in!
*ALARM*
Look sharp! Command sent word that we're in for quite a fight.
@BATTLE
No wonder we were recruited for this mission. We've got some real varmints kicking around out here.

Fields.MenuText: Oh, it's not so bad.
We're lucky to have you.
Do you think the Morganas know we're up to something?

Fields.DialogueText: It's the worst. But we've just got to be worse than the worst!
Damn straight, and we aren't even halfway there yet. I bet the pace is going to pick up quick.
I won't tell 'em if you don't.
Once we reach the outpost, we'll send a signal to Command.
Top secret, right? So the signal's got to be a code of some kind.
Hmm.
What's the code, Kanchou?
Top secret.
Kanchou, you know I'll just listen in on the radio crew.
Lone Ranger.
What?
That's your call sign for letting Command know we're here.
Ha! Wait, wait, don't tell me... the package is the "silver bullet?" And Kanchou... are you--
You're not calling me Tonto.
Hahaha! Someone up high must be a cowboy fan! "A fiery horse with the speed of light, a cloud of dust, and a hearty HI-YO, SILVER!"
It's going to be a long mission.
Finally we're back on track.
The detour wasn't all bad.

Fields.MenuText: Leave aside the Morganas and the scenic route is nice.
The direct course would have been better.
We did what was right in the moment.

Fields.DialogueText: That fresh air, the spirit of uncharted territory. I love those wide open spaces!
No sense mourning the could-have-beens. We've got to follow that trail wherever it takes us.
No plan survives contact with the enemy. But this ocean sure did!
It's a little strange for a cowgirl to be so enchanted with the ocean.
It's like the great frontiers used to be. So much is still unexplored. And did you know that the world is mostly made up of water? That means there's a ton of room for us to run wild.
But we're not renegades. We're soldiers. We have a place to go.
For now, Kanchou. When this war is over and Japan rebuilds, I'll still be looking for a fight.
You'd be good at that. Maybe too good for the Imperial Navy to let you go so easily.
They should have thought of that before they named me after Hokkaido's wildest river.
@BATTLE
In my country, we call them rōnin. Masterless warriors. Same basic principle.
A lone ranger, eh?
There were pirates and bandits before the Funayūrei. I don't need a commander to defend the innocent from those.
Now let's sweep away these Funayūrei!
If the ocean is kind of like the Wild West, then doesn't that mean there's plenty of crime out here as well?
Especially in the East Indies. But they aren't really anything like those silly stories with eye patches and peg legs.
Cowboys versus pirates... heh.
It sounds like a fun story, but hopefully we never live through it. We have enough problems with the Funayūrei.
And Navy or pirate, I bet they're equal opportunity monsters.
Those Funayūrei... they're horrendous. How do you think they live with themselves?

Fields.MenuText: I think that they have no heart.
They're just not like us.
They can't even live with each other sometimes.

Fields.DialogueText: They must have no heart to slaughter everyone around with absolutely no remorse. At least we feel something.
I wish I could say our differences make us strong here, but that's just not the case. I don't think we'll ever get along.
It's so strange to see them squabbling for scrap. Somehow it doesn't make me feel better.
We'll stop them, Yūbari. Don't worry.
I'm not nervous. I know that this is what war is all about. That fight of good and evil. I feel like it'll never end.
There's the outpost. If what Command says is true, our package will bring us one step closer.
Well, look lively, Kanchou. We've got some outlaws who want to tangle with the Lone Ranger!
@BATTLE
Outpost A, Yūbari. And even that term is generous.
It almost looks abandoned.
Well, these are the coordinates, and we've been acknowledged by Command. We're in the right place.
I wonder what the silver bullet is.

Fields.MenuText: Something to fight the Morganas?
A way out of this war?
It could just be supplies for all we know.

Fields.DialogueText: There's always some kind of secret experiment going on. And not just in the comics.
The silver bullet's a silver bullet, eh? Wouldn't that be nice...
If I find out I've been transporting fish and melons that I can't eat, I might challenge someone to a shootout.
Well, the retrieval crew should be halfway there by now.
They'd better move faster. Those are Fūnayurei coming our way!
I'm not surprised they found us... but it looks like they're targeting our retrieval team! We can't let them wreck the mission.
Never mind the mission! We need to circle our wagons and protect the party.
You all heard the Belle. Let's move!
@BATTLE
We did it. Somehow.
All retrieval crew accounted for. And the silver bullet's safe in my hold.
That gets us halfway there.
Well, what did they bring us?
@BATTLE

Fields.MenuText: If I had to guess... it looks like it would fit a gun of some kind.
Classified.
Looks an awful lot like a crate.

Fields.DialogueText: Anything we can use on the Funayūrei is okay in my book.
It's going to be a long mission.
Don't tease me, Kanchou! I hate being left out of a secret.
We're under explicit orders not to open it. Unless...
So it's something that might save us... which makes it dangerous.
I don't like it either. But we've got another outpost to get to.
We've got a bag of rattlers tied to the saddle, Kanchou.
Well, when you put it that way it just sounds dangerous.
*ALARM*
Unless absolutely necessary. That's direct from Command.
Unless?
It's not dangerous to us, or we'd never have to open it. And they wouldn't sacrifice a Belle for anything.
So we protect it. No matter what it is.
Dangerous keeps you alive... as long as you know how it works.
Speaking of...
We've got to keep moving quickly. Intel suggests there are pirates in the area preying on civilian shipping.
Just the same as any other mission. I want this thing off me as quickly as possible.
It's that much of a problem for you?
Bag of rattlers, Kanchou. All we get out of this is vague unease at best. Danger, extremely possibly.

Fields.MenuText: Isn't that what you signed up for? Danger?
As soon as this is over, I'm getting us an assignment in Australian waters.
I usually try to distract myself with paperwork.

Fields.DialogueText: Danger from Japan's enemies. From the Funayūrei. Not from... whatever it is our people are working on.
Now there's a frontier I'd like to cross one day.
I never was one for lesser evils.
Whatever it is, I'm glad it's on our side.
The human side? Or the Japanese side? Or your side and mine?
Those are the same for now.
For now, Kanchou. That's what really worries me.
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
Nothing for it but to keep our side afloat.
Damn it. I must have misplaced my binoculars. Is that a ship or an island?
Let me take a look...
Morgana?
Human. Did we expect guests today, Kanchou?

Fields.MenuText: Not until at least after the mission.
The Imperial Navy would have announced themselves.
It looks Japanese, but the flag... it's not right.

Fields.DialogueText: Hmm. It's... Japanese? A patrol boat? They're hailing us...
Well, they're hailing us now. Maybe they aren't here officially.
It's... black? I think they're hailing.
No longer. We represent those who yearn for a peaceful future for the Empire.
Wait... civilians? You're the pirates we've heard about!
The cargo you carry is a weapon, dangerous to you and to the Empire and her neighbors. For the sake of our common humanity--
Leave us alone, or we'll blow you out of the water. As you can see, we're a damn sight bigger than you.
This will not be our last request. Expect us.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
Machigainaku. It's a ship, Kanchou.
Ossu. This is the Imperial light cruiser Yūbari. Am I addressing a vessel of the Imperial Navy?
This is Yūbari's captain speaking. How the hell are you operating out here without Imperial or League support?
Local civilians have rendered aid for the greater good. Ours are the last demands they will fulfill.
They're just giving up?
Grr... Pirates they may be, but they know how to pick their battles.
And I'm assuming the civilians didn't render aid altogether voluntarily.
But they'll be grateful they did it in the end.
You handled those pirates quite well, Yūbari.
If there's one thing they respect, it's force.
But they didn't even try to threaten us.
I wish they had. I really wish they had.

Fields.MenuText: We don't want to go picking unnecessary fights.
They could have been trouble for us.
We could have taken them.

Fields.DialogueText: If it's pirates, it's a necessary fight.
Never.
That's what makes me angry.
What were they saying about the cargo being a weapon?
Wait... are those the pirates out there?
They're attacking something...
They're the ones under attack! Kanchou, the Funayūrei!
I guess it is the honorable thing to do. Let's go rescue the pirates from the Morganas.
@BATTLE
They're lucky I hate demons more.
Yūbari?
Just forget it, Kanchou.
Ie. Because I respect force.
Aren't we going to call this in?
Still wish we had given you that weapon?
We will not sit idly by while the Empire harvests weapons from the bones of the demons she fights.
Kanchou?

Fields.MenuText: I'll put in a good word for you, but only if you agree to lay down your arms.
We have our orders. This isn't our weapon to hand over.
Piracy is piracy. We ought to hand you over to the Imperial Navy.

Fields.DialogueText: The Navy has already stricken us from the rolls. We're at peace with that.
It shouldn't be anyone's.
You have our permission to sink us first.
... Get out of here. Quickly.
And good riddance, too.
Yūbari, you're shaking.
They just rub me the wrong way. I'm fine.
You don't look fine.
Leave me alone, Kanchou. We've got more Funayūrei to fry.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
You feared it so much that you turned to piracy.
Please, Kami-sama. The Noborito Laboratory is more of a madhouse every day.
When information leaked about a weapon based on Funayūrei technology... we feared the worst.
Better piracy than defect to another navy that wants those weapons just as badly.
We're on a tight schedule already. We don't have time to fight them or imprison them. At this point, it's more of a death sentence to let them try and survive out here.
Really?
I guess I owe you a little bit of an apology.
No. But I would like to know what's going on. You really froze up the other day.
I just read too many comic books, Kanchou.
What do you mean?
I'm not blind. What I hear about the war on the mainland... it'd chill your blood, or heat it up something awful.

Fields.MenuText: It's nothing to do with us.

Fields.DialogueText: We're here to make the world safe. It's everything to do with us.
There's only so much you can do, Yūbari.
The world is mostly made up of water, Kanchou. That's the extent of my powers over right and wrong. That, and the range of my guns beyond that.
One day, the Funayūrei won't be here. Or the Kami won't be. Our war will end.
I know we can't save everyone. But we have the responsibility to try. If what they say is true... letting one of those weapons into your land war is the same as pulling the trigger ourselves.
Don't remind me. Even if I could do something about it... we're all trying to survive. I don't have to hurt others to do it.

Fields.MenuText: I try to avoid it.
Maybe those pirates had a point.

Fields.DialogueText: If you truly can't stomach it... well, not everyone can.
Your words, not mine.
And we had to hear it from pirates.
Yūbari... you're a good person. You're a good Belle. Whatever Command might want of us... if you're out here fighting, you're making the world safer.
You wear your sense of justice proudly. If enough of us see it... it might catch on.
Arigatō, Kanchou. I learned it from the best.
Amazing what comic cowboys can teach us, eh?
Someone has to.
Got it together, Yūbari?
Always. Just give me a target.
@BATTLE
Kanchou, do you have a moment?
What's on your mind?
Gomen nasai. I was... in a dark place.

Fields.MenuText: Don't be sorry. We all have our moments.
Are you still?
It's been on my mind a lot.

Fields.DialogueText: I hope I haven't bothered you with mine.
You're helping.
I thought it might be. Maybe it's for the best.
I swiped the last melon from the galley. Split it?
You're a wonder, Kanchou.
Just doing my part for the Fleet.
I needed something to soak up the coffee.
Have you slept lately?
Too busy thinking on all this. Where we're going. What we're doing. How it'll all turn out.
Well, time's up.
Nothing to worry about. I think I've had enough of it.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
What would the Lone Ranger do?
"The rule of what is best for the greatest number." You could make a case for this mission being that.
Well, the coast looks clear. At this rate, we'll reach Outpost B in no time.
Just as long as the Funayūrei don't slow us down.
*ALARM*
We'll just have to make this a quick draw.
You know I'm good at those. But I thought our spotters had given us the all clear.
Wait... that ship out there looks familiar. Look, it's those pirates!
They're still out here?

Fields.MenuText: We should have let them die.
I knew they'd double-cross us!
What do you think they want?

Fields.DialogueText: I hate pirates, Kanchou... but they're only human. A Kami does not simply let people die.
They're pirates. Of course they had plans to double-cross us.
Maybe they wanted that weapon for themselves after all.
I can't see... they seem to be hanging something from their ship. What is it?
... Kanchou, those aren't the pirates. It's the Funayūrei! They've just scavenged the hull from that rogue vessel.
Looks like no one's safe in this war.
@BATTLE
Leave it to the Morganas to pull a fast one.
*ALARM*
Yūbari, on the bridge immediately!
@BATTLE
We can't fall for any more tricks, Yūbari. We can't afford any lost time.
You're right. We're already low on supplies.
How did we get so low?
We haven't been able to restock since we picked that weapon up. We've been under orders to lay low, so that meant no resupply runs.

Fields.MenuText: I still would have risked it.
Well, that makes sense to me.
All to protect the innocent!

Fields.DialogueText: No, Kanchou. If another supply ship was lost to the Funayūrei because of us, I would never forgive myself!
We couldn't put anyone in harm's way.
It's our job to make sure that no one gets hurt, not even the ships who help give us supplies.
What are the odds we make it to our destination in time?
If I'm running the calculations correctly... not very good.
We need to start rationing yesterday.
Even coffee?
Especially coffee. We've got to keep constant watch.
What is it the Americans say? Fiddlesticks?
Ryōkai! We're not letting them get the drop on us again!
That too.
Or risk a third party discovering the weapon.
Once we get a proper resupply, you're getting ten pounds of coffee for your own personal use. You've more than earned it.
I can almost smell it now. That just might keep me going...
There they go.
I hate to let those girls limp off. But we need to get to our objective.
What?
No, you definitely don't. Hold on...

Fields.MenuText: Whatever it is, it must be important.
Can we figure out how to use it?
Well, we can't ask the pirates.

Fields.DialogueText: The weapon must be quite powerful. And we're the ones who have to get it there...
I don't know if we should risk it.
If only I'd thought to.
I felt it vibrating. And it was making the strangest whirring noise. Almost as if...
*BOOM*
Damn it! We're going to have to make some of those evasive maneuvers we're famous for.
Brace yourself, Kanchou. I'm about to do my best impersonation of a mechanical bull!
@BATTLE
Wait... Do you feel that?
What's gotten into her?
No! Kanchou, the silver bullet-
What the... Is that what you're holding?
The crate was damaged during our maneuvers. The object itself... looks all right? It's not like any weapon I've ever seen.
Kanchou! Get down!
What just happened?
The silver bullet fired... and it looks like it took out at least one of those fleeing Funayūrei.
Along with everything within at least five hundred feet. I can still see the ocean boiling.

Fields.MenuText: This could turn the tide of the war.
We have to get rid of it.
What kind of weapon is this?

Fields.DialogueText: Not likely. We still don't know how it works. And I think it's gone dead anyway.
I agree. Good thing we're dropping it off at the outpost soon. And good riddance, too!
It's powerful. I don't even know how it works. But it fired a blast that was stronger than anything else we have.
Who could have made something like this?
The pirates said something about Noborito. That's in Kawasaki. I've heard rumors about our Army R&D people working there...
Ugly ones.
I guess they thought they needed all the armaments they could get.
Well, if their aim is to scare off the Morganas, they've failed.
Some kind of weapon based on Funayūrei tech... They must be able to sense the energy that came from the blast.
@BATTLE
Well, that ain't your average six-shooter.
Just look at that thing that almost blew us up.
Thank goodness you pointed it the right way.
Or they're jealous of the poor imitation.
They're green with envy, eh? Those yellow-bellies won't be so tough once we beat the blue out of them!
What do you think Command was going to do with this?

Fields.MenuText: Coastal defense?
The mainland war?
Whatever they were planning, they have to fix it first.

Fields.DialogueText: It would be a formidable weapon. But I can't imagine what we might face if the Funayūrei adapted to it.
I don't even want to think about that.
There's that, at least.
Maybe there's some clues in the dossier we received with the weapon?
All redacted. We're in the dark here.
Even after the war, this weapon would be devastating. I don't know if I've ever seen anything else like it.
Nor I.
I don't think we can lay this at Command's feet. But they definitely signed off on the Imperial Army's little experiment.
The Army... What were they going to use it for?
*ALARM*
Looks like a fair few of them. Wishing we could turn it on right about now?
You couldn't pay me enough.
@BATTLE
You're looking better.
Whoever that might be against.
We can't always pick the right fights. But we can at least make the most of what equipment we have.
Heh. Funny that you say so, Kanchou.

Fields.MenuText: I believe in you. I believe in us.
Even if it's a superweapon.
I have my moments.

Fields.DialogueText: As long as you do, I'll feel a little bit better.
You carry a pistol hoping you never have to use it, but sometimes they fire themselves.
They keep me going.
So what's so funny?
Making the most of our equipment... that's the Lone Ranger's creed. Doing the greatest good with what you've got, wherever you are.
That's the way of a true rōnin.
One day, Yūbari. They'd be crazy not to turn you loose.
Careful what you wish for, Kanchou. There's no Lone Ranger without Tonto.
I'll keep wishing, kemosabe. Looks like we've got outlaws on the horizon...
@BATTLE
I'm feeling better. A quiet evening in with some candles and the Lone Ranger helps with that.
Well, it's not our problem anymore. Now we can get back to the fight.
If I never have to transport another superweapon again, it'll be too soon.
Along with offloading the silver bullet.
It'd be nice to choose how and where, wouldn't it?
Well, I'm dreading the next meeting with Command.
What did you end up saying?
The truth. The mission was a failure. The weapon was damaged in transit, as part of evasive maneuvers that saved you and everyone aboard.
We're alive, and we're tanning Funayūrei hide. I'd call that a success.
I might have also been a little more explicit in my write-up than the Imperial censor would like. But the more that's redacted, the more questions Command will have.
Well, that's hardly our fault, is it?

Fields.MenuText: I just wish we could have gotten rid of that thing.

Fields.DialogueText: Daisansei desu. But that might have caused more problems than it solved.

Fields.MenuText: I'll take a nasty letter from the Imperial Army once in a while if it keeps things like that out of the war.
I've almost convinced myself we couldn't have possibly been more careful.

Fields.DialogueText: You ride a bronco, you better expect it to buck now and again.
We can't stop it, Kanchou, but we can certainly slow it down.
I think we've done our part.
I think you're right. And if we haven't... well, the Lone Ranger had something to say about that too.
What's that?
"That sooner or later... somewhere... somehow... we must settle with the world and make payment for what we have taken."
If that's on your mind, I don't think you have to worry.
I can't speak for my whole country, Kanchou. But I've got a pretty good yodel. That counts for something.
